allSaves.value: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

details.publicNotes: Ice dragons are smarter than white dragons, semi-translucent ranging from clear frosty to glacial blue like the ice in their environment. With their magical abilities, deception, and stealth, they like to masquerade as other chromatic and metallic dragons and many an adventuring party has gone after what seems to be a blue, lightning and all, only to discover it was actually a glacial blue ice dragon. They like to freeze prey solid as lair decorations, or a later snack. Often, they treat others as objects either to be collected or traded away from their frozen hoard.

description.value:
On a successful hit with the ice dragon's claw, jaws, horn, or tail Strikes, the target must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save or take a -5 penalty to their Speed, their body filled with chills and shivering with cold. Successive hits on the creature increases this penalty, with a maximum value of -25. At the end of their turn, if the creature's Speed would be reduced by 25 with this effect, it must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save or be turned to solid ice. This second effect has the incapacitation trait.

@UUID[Compendium.ponyfinder-bestiary-of-everglow.ponyfinder-bestiary-effects.Item.RenNfifnfxis7MuW]{Effect: Chilling Factor}

Effects which would return a body to its fleshly components, such as the stone to flesh spell, will return a creature turned into ice back to normal. Additionally, creatures can make a single Interact action to warm themselves and reduce this cumulative penalty inflicted by this effect by 5. If the creature comes into contact or proximity to a heat source, is affected by an ability or spell with the fire trait, or takes fire damage, this also reduces the cumulative penalty inflicted by this effect by 5.

The ice dragon fires from its jowls a flurry of diamond-sharp icicles that deal @Damage[9d6[cold],4d12[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic] save). Additionally, targets that fail their reflex saving throw are subjected to the ice dragon's Chilling Factor. A creature that critically fails automatically takes a -10 penalty to their Speed. It cannot use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

The coloration of the glacial body and form can be altered at a whim; this gives the ice dragon an appearance similar to another true dragon, changing their frozen scales to a chosen dragon’s color. This increases the DC to Recall Knowledge on the ice dragon from a standard DC to a hard DC for its level, unless a character makes a successful check against the ice dragon’s Deception DC. The duration of this effect is indefinite.

You sculpt an ice barrier that blocks sight and, once shattered, freezes foes. You create either a 1-foot-thick wall of ice in a straight line up to 60 feet long and 10 feet high (the wall doesn't have to be vertical, but it must be anchored on both sides to a solid surface) or a 1-foot-thick, 10-foot radius hemisphere of ice. The ice that makes up the wall is opaque. If you wish, the wall can be of a smaller length, height, or radius.

You must create the wall in an unbroken open space so its edges don't pass through any creatures or objects, or the spell is lost. Each 10-foot-by-10-foot section of the wall has AC 10, Hardness 10, and 40 Hit Points, and it's immune to critical hits, cold damage, and precision damage. A section also has weakness to fire 15; a section of the wall destroyed by fire melts, evaporating into water and steam. A section destroyed by means other than fire leaves behind a chilling mass of ice that is difficult terrain and deals 2d6 cold damage to any creature passing through it.

Heightened (+2) The Hit Points of each section of the wall increase by 10, and the cold damage dealt to creatures crossing a destroyed section increases by 1d6.

You call forth a cloud of mist. All creatures within the mist become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the mist become concealed to creatures within it. You can Dismiss the cloud.

A violent wind issues forth from your palm, blowing from the point where you are when you Cast the Spell to the line's opposite end. The wind extinguishes small non-magical fires, disperses fog and mist, blows objects of light Bulk or less around, and pushes larger objects. Large or smaller creatures in the area must attempt a Fortitude save. Large or smaller creatures that later move into the gust must attempt the save on entering.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature can't move against the wind.

Failure The creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If it was flying, it takes the effects of critical failure instead.

Critical Failure The creature is pushed 30 feet in the wind's direction, knocked prone, and takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage.

duration.value: until the start of your next turn

description.value: The dragon recharges their Breath Weapon whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.
The dragon recharges their Breath Weapon whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.
Snow does not impair an ice dragon's vision; it ignores concealment from snowfall.
The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.
